title: What can affect our perception of the truth as we see it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Our own opinions and standards kind of imposed by society. When you realize that these standards are made by people who want to control your life and money, you begin to see a glimpse of the truth. I’m not saying to you that you aren’t allowed to have opinions to see the truth, but not judging before you know and not judging based on society stardards.

Primarily, it is the ‘me-colored’ glasses that lie between us and the Truth that filter, distort and mess up the message before it gets to our brain. Part of our lifetime task of leaning to discover and invent who we uniquely are is also learning how to gradually remove the ‘me’ from the message.
